title: [BEAM-10419] Ignore FhirIOWriteIT testFhirIO_Import instead of FhirIO
body:
ReadIT **Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-9629] Fix several connection leak issues.
body:
* Make the default max connections to be unlimited. This mirrors the 2.17 and earlier behavior since we used to create one DataSource per execution thread (and hence one connection). * Move connection fetching to @ProcessElement to not hold a connection for empty bundles. * Make sure that finalize() closes the connection so that it is returned to the pool if the bundle fails. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10407,10408] SchemaIOTableProviderWrapper and implementations for Avro and Parquet
body:
Implemented SchemaIO and SchemaCapableIOProvider for Avro and Parquet, shifting logic to core Beam. title: Widen ranges for GCP libraries
body:
GCP libraries follow semantic versioning, so no breaking changes are made within a major version. Loosening the range reduces the likelihood of dependency conflicts for users. Note that some of the ranges include a pre-1.0 version on the lower end (1.0 was historically used to signal "GA" so there were no breaking changes for these libraries between 0.x.x and 1.x.x) ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-8472] get default GCP region option (Go)
body:
If the region flag is unset, attempt to extract a region from $CLOUDSDK_COMPUTE_REGION and the gcloud SDK. This mirrors the [Java](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/64e69d68f85903d94170fa2efc5a1633d82da589/runners/google-cloud-dataflow-java/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/dataflow/options/DataflowPipelineOptions.java#L218) and [Python](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/72d9744affc6ff4a63816f737e18c4abe14f245f/sdks/python/apache_beam/runners/dataflow/dataflow_runner.py#L1437) implementation. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-10420] Move restriction/watermark estimator state into PerWindowInvoker

title: [BEAM-10414] Fix FlinkStreamingImpulseSource translation
body:
The proprietary FlinkStreamingImpulse stopped working from 2.20.0 on. Its functionality can now be realized via timers, so it should ultimately be removed or replaced: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-10415. title: [BEAM-10410] Move Kafka directly to io submodule.
body:
This is a cherry pick of https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/12168 into the release branch. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Fix threading issue with default artifact resolver registration.
body:

title: [BEAM-10409] Add combiner packing to graph optimizer phases
body:
Adds `pack_combiners` graph optimization phases to the translations module. This allows packs compatible CombinePerKey stages with a common input into a single stage. This improves performance for use cases of Beam that create thousands of Combine stages with a common input. title: Pass the pipeline's options when visualizing the pipeline graph.
body:
The pipeline graph visualization doesn't depend on the Interactive Runner. It should pass the pipeline's options automatically so that pipelines built from other runners such as a `DataflowRunner` can pass the runner api conversion validations in the visualization logic. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Remove the non-actional warning message
body:
The warning message about not being able to extract a pipeline from a given pvalueish is not actionable to the user. The altering of PTransform label should be a best-effort try. The warning message might confuse the user if their logging configuration emits the message in the notebook. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-9895] Added integration test for SnowflakeIO
body:
Added integration test for SnowflakeIO. To run it, a real Snowflake instance has to be created and configured. Once [this thread on dev-list](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/ra9a70bfd2a2c253de7b8e90320ef6e03c04245969b4dedad8c3df723%40%3Cdev.beam.apache.org%3E) about account donation for integration tests finishes we'll followup with Jenkins job so it can be run on CI. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-10239] Support ZetaSQL NUMERIC type in BeamSQL
body:
__This PR adds support of ZetaSQL NUMERIC type to BeamSQL:__ - ADD - SUBTRACT - MULTIPLY - DIVIDE - UNARY_MINUS - MOD - FLOOR - CEIL While __*AVG*__ and __*SUM*__ are currently not supported. r: @apilloud @robinyqiu ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-XXX] JdbcIO - Allow customization of the PoolableDataSource's pool
body:
*Note: I don't have a lot of time to write this PR, I'll add more details when I get the chance.* My team has been experiencing issues when we use the default `JdbcIO.write()` in our streaming pipelines. The main problem is the large amount of connections being opened over time. I had a look at the support for pooling and noticed that the object pool is configured to only hold one connection per worker. We've tried that in the past (without the Jdbc SDK) and ended up with a very bad bottleneck. Of course increasing the number of connections available won't solve all our problems, but having a finer grained control over the pool being used would at least allow some experimentation. All this change does is factor out the default pool construction to a factory, set by default to the one in current use. For now I'm submitting this for review and thoughts from other contributors/maintainers to see if this is headed in the wrong direction. I can work around this in the time by manually delegating to a connection pool, but I'll be missing all the other great features the SDK provides (batching, connection management per-bundle, ...). Let me know what you think, I'll get back to you asap! :) ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] ~~If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf).~~ See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10185] Building python wheels for Windows (on Github Actions)
body:
This PR adds the Windows configuration to the existing mechanism that generates python wheels using Github Actions. As the POSIX functions `usleep` and `clock_gettime` are not present on the Windows platform, alternative versions have to be implemented using native API. The conditional compilation (depending on the platform) is introduced to choose the correct implementation. On Windows XP and later the implementation of `clock_gettime` is guaranteed to have a resolution higher than 1s. The real resolution of the `usleep` seems to be around tens of s on my machine. That's about two orders of magnitude worse than posix version on my ubuntu, but that's probably related to the OS scheduler. Anyway, that shouldn't be an issue in the current usage of the function. Credits for @TobKed for the Github actions configuration. I've only helped with the proper cythonization on Windows. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-10403] Removed asterisk from default file prefix in SnowflakeIO
body:
There was asterisk in default prefix for staged files in SnowflakeIO. It was created passed for matching and saving files based on prefix, but in the end it became part of name of saved files, what may cause matching problems using gsutils. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-10166] Improve execution time errors with more concise error messages from DoFns
body:
The Go SDK uses errors returned by DoFns to signal failures to process bundles, and terminate bundle processing. However, if the preceding DoFn uses emitters, rather than error returns, the code has no choice to panic to avoid user code handling or ignoring the cross DoFn error (which could cause dataloss or other correctness problems). All bundle executions are wrapped in `callNoPanic` to prevent worker termination on such panics, and orderly terminate just the affected bundle instead.`callNoPanic` uses Go's built in recover mechanism to get the error and provide a stack trace. This is message is not necessarily helpful to the user and can lead to degraded user experience when debugging such errors. In this patch, we introduce a new type of error; a `doFnError` which has a more concise representation of the DoFn which failed, the error which the DoFn failed with and other meta information. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9953[SQL][ZetaSQL] Support Pure SQL user-defined table-valued function.
body:
This PR adds the support of ``` "CREATE TABLE FUNCTION CustomerRange(MinID INT64, MaxID INT64)\n" " AS\n" " SELECT *\n" " FROM KeyValue\n" " WHERE key >= MinId AND key <= MaxId; \n" " SELECT key FROM CustomerRange(10, 14)"; ``` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-9889] Populate local instance of InfluxDB with data
body:
The goal of these changes is to make the process of creating and modifying Grafana dashboards easier by populating InfluxDB database with real data. Two workflows have been implemented: * a cronjob that makes a full backup of InfluxDB and sends it to a public GCS bucket. The bucket has object versioning[1] enabled. It also has a lifecycle rule[2] that keeps only the 14 most recent versions of the backup. * a docker-compose service that starts just after InfluxDB, downloads the latest version of the backup and restore its content. [1] https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/object-versioning [2] https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/lifecycle ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9712] Refactor ZetaSQL planner code and support setting default timezone
body:
Enable setting default timezone option on ZetaSQL analyzer. Default timezone is used both at - query analysis time (e.g. `CAST` literal to `TIMESTAMP`), and - expression execution time (e.g. `TIMESTAMP()` constructor). Also simplified some ZetaSQL planner code, including: - remove unnecessary and confusing builder pattern in `SqlAnalyzer` - remove unused method `analyze()` in `SqlAnalyzer` - remove unnecessary `Planner` interface implementation in `ZetaSQLPlannerImpl` - add a different overload of `BeamEnumerableConverter.toRowList()` for compliance test harness r: @apilloud cc: @ibzib @kennknowles Post-Commit Tests Status (on master branch) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Lang | SDK | Dataflow | Flink | Samza | Spark | Twister2 --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- Go | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- Java | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/)

title: [BEAM-10402] Enable checker framework, disabled everywhere since every module has errors. Eliminate some errors (but no complete modules)
body:
I enabled the checker framework to replace findbugs since spotbugs doesn't really check nullability meaningfully and checker is actually sound (aka you cannot have NPE if you get it right). I immediately discovered over 100 nullability errors in the main Java SDK, and there is no module that is correct. So it is disabled everywhere and it is a useful starter task to re-enable it and fix a file or a whole module. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9754] Add Py 3.8 support to Dataflow runner.
body:
Adds Py3.8 support to Dataflow runner now that Dataflow provides Py 3.8 containers. Also add a user warning for Py3.8 and newer versions for which Apache Beam does not yet have robust test coverage. title: [BEAM-10400] Fix race condition in DirectRunner watermark update
body:
Fixes [BEAM-10400] ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9896] Add streaming for SnowflakeIO.Write to Java SDK
body:
SnowflakeIO streaming write support. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-10398] Use GitHub Actions in wheels release process for Python
body:
Thanks to using GitHub Actions to build Python Source Distribution and Wheels it can be used in release process. It will simplify release process and using external repository for wheels will not be needed anymore (https://github.com/apache/beam-wheels) ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-9897] Add cross-language support to SnowflakeIO.Read
body:
This PR is part of adding SnowflakeIO to Java SDK [BEAM-9893](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-9893). Mainly this PR is adding support for cross-language read operation ([BEAM-9897](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-9897)) . ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [X] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [X] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [X] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM 7624] Added Null Behavior in JsonToRow
body:
Added support for changing the null read behavior of JsonToRow using the changes done in RowJson. Added NullBehavior to JsonToRow, and some corresponding tests. Notes: I needed to add the volatile flag on the NullBehavior on JsonToRowFn because spotbugs would complain about threading issues if I didn't. Didn't end up doing anything with the BeamSQL Json stuff as I don't have any experience with BeamSQL and looked like quite a lot of internal code surrounding it. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-10136] [BEAM-10135] Add JdbcIO for cross-language with python wrapper
body:
Encountered problems: 1. For now the python transforms are very limited as RowCoder is yet to be upgraded: - Write can accept only primitive types without boolean, bytes - Read can accept even more limited types because LogicalTypes are not implemented in python 2. Write transform uses JdbcIO.write() - it would be better to use writeRows() with automated Row coder when it's implemented. In general coders need to be upgraded before these transforms are usable. R: @TheNeuralBit ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-10395] Deduplicate uploads by destinations before uploading
body:
If a job is configured to upload multiple files to the same destination, they'll end up attempting to overwrite each other in parallel, causing the runner to need to retry multiple times until one wins the race. This change deduplicates them by destination. R: @lukecwik @pabloem ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-10004] Fixes occasional ZeroDivisionError when bundle size weights become 0 for MongoDB IO
body:
Depending on runner and the mongo collection to read, the bundle size can fall below 1mb which resulted in Source Bundles with weight=0. This lead to a zero division error (raised from [here](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/23d0c474576e5e58a62a17443587bbd1e9d7e5c3/sdks/python/apache_beam/io/concat_source.py#L154) since the `total` becomes 0). Moving the application of the lower bound to before the source bundle creation makes sure the source bundle size does not become zero. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9615] Add Row coder functions.
body:
Adds row encoder and decoder function generators, using reflection. Doesn't provide single element convenience functions for encoding and decoding struct values. Doesn't support looking up Logical types, or handling Map types at present, but this is sufficient to pass standard_coders.yaml for now. Subsequent PRs will hook this into framework use. Remaining work includes: * Adding reference kinds for this coder in the rest of the coder package. * Hooking those into graphx/coder.go * Converting Go types to Schemas and vice versa. * Validation and restrictions on such types (eg unexported fields). * Hooking this into the exec package. * Submitting the standard_coders.yaml validation for the Go SDK. * Swapping this to default over JSON encoding. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-10392] Attempt to fix/enable detection of rabbitmq:test stuckness.
body:
* Ensure that the Consumer uses a thread safe object to pass the messages through (Consumer is invoked on a separate thread as per https://rabbitmq.github.io/rabbitmq-java-client/api/current/com/rabbitmq/client/Consumer.html) * Add a timeout for the entire test class so we can get a stack trace to narrow down where we are seeing stuckness ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10391] Add attribute map null check in dataflow worker
body:
attributeMap seems to be nullable based on tests, but we don't have a null check in the dataflow worker's PubsubSink. This PR also sprinkles some `@Nullable` annotations into `PubsubMessage` to make it clear. title: [BEAM-10385] Integrate SQL expansion into Flink job server
body:
The expansion server is started with the job server to allow for an expansion of external transforms during pipeline submission. At the moment, an extra expansion server has to be started to expand SqlTransform. It would be desirable to include the SQL expansion into the expansion server that is started with the job server. title: [BEAM-10417] - Move Shared object from tfx_bsl

title: [BEAM-9615] Add bytes, bool, and iterable coders
body:
Add bytes, bool, and iterable coders to the graph/coders package. This is in preparation of the next PR which has the first pass at the row encoder, so these building blocks can be reviewed separately. The bool and bytes coders are code migrated from the exec package, but it was striking me as odd to have so much encoding implementation living in exec/coder.go when much of it was in this graph/coder package. Those implementations will be replaced with the ones in this PR as appropriate (eg. iterables will necessarily be implemented in the Datasource package as well to support Large CoGBKs via the state channel for example.) Iterables demonstrate how to handle reflective encoding with nested types, in this case, with a nested coder. As much as possible, it's best to avoid swapping back and forth through reflect.Values as that adds extensive overhead, which is why these are implemented in terms of reflect.Value. This doesn't matter for the primitive types which have efficient extraction methods from the reflect.Value containers. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: MetricFilter matching by Metric objects.
body:
This change would encourage reusing predefined metric objects in metric queries. Querying with the metric object may result more maintainable code than duplicating the name and namespace strings. Or storeing the names elsewhere as CONSTANT_NAME. **Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: Revert "[BEAM-9890] Support BIT_AND aggregation function in Beam SQL"
body:
Reverts apache/beam#12079



It turns out that on direct runner, NULL will not be passed to CombineFn thus all NULL inputs are ignored. And then if there is any non-null inputs, bit_and will be applied on them only, which leads to a non-null result, which is not correct.

Before we can figure out the root cause and propose a fix, we should revert this implementation.

title: [BEAM-10373] Add Missing Markdown Documentation for Java Katas Introduction
body:
When #11761 was merged it, it appears that one of the related task files `task.md` for the 'Introduction' section of the Beam Katas for Java was moved as opposed to being copied over. This has caused issues when building the Java Katas and has been widely regarded as a bad move. This PR should address this issue. I've reviewed the previous pull request for any additional moved files, and it appears that this was the only missing one. CC: @henryken ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-7705] Add BigQuery Java samples

title: [BEAM-10343] Add dispositions for SnowflakeIO.write
body:
This PR is part of adding SnowflakeIO to Java SDK [BEAM-9893](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-9893). Precisely this PR is adding following dispositions for write operation([BEAM-10343](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-10343)): - CREATE_IF_NEEDED - default behaviour. The write operation checks whether the specified target table exists; if it does not, the write operation attempts to create the table Specify the schema for the target table using the .withTableSchema() option. - CREATE_NEVER - The write operation fails if the target table does not exist. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [X] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [X] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: To match new BigQuery API
body:
beam.io.ReadFromBigQuery no longer present **Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier).
